intro: Sphaeralcea ribifolia, commonly known as the redstem globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round, greenish fruits called capsules, which contain numerous seeds. Sphaeralcea ribifolia thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert and grassland habitats. It is a valuable plant for pollinators and is adapted to arid environments with its deep root system.
